docTitle.titlePart:
Alkali-Halide Chemiluminescence : Studies on the Fluctuation Bands
from some Alkali (Li, Na, R)-Halogen (CI, Br, I)-Reactions

byline.affiliation: I . Institut für Experimentalphysik der Universität Hamburg

front.div:
Molecular chemiluminescence spectra from selected alkali-halogen reactions are presented
using a beam-gas arrangement operating with pressures between 10 -1 mtorr ( single collision
conditions ) up to 10 mtorr in the reaction zone. Spectra are presented for the chemiluminescent
reactions M2 -f X2- MX * + MX, where M2 — K2» Na2 and X2 = C^t B*2,I2. The MX * emitter
is identified by comparison with previous absorption and emission studies of these molecules. The
sodium reaction with 12 as well as all lithium reactions with different halogens ( CI2, Br2,12 ) do
not yield appreciable molecular emission. The difference« in molecular chemiluminescence inten-
sities among this type of reactions can be understood in terms of the Landau-Zener formalism for
an electron jump and turn out to be consistent with the results from measurements on absorption,
emission and dissociation.
